data.title: Uncaught RangeError: Invalid array length
data.body:
I have a 1200+ line bash script, which I can't edit using Atom. I can open it, but if I scroll down a little bit, the whole editor part goes blank and I get multiple "Uncaught RangeError: Invalid array length" errors thrown in the console (which launches automatically as a result).

Here is one of the traces (doesn't paste nicely):
![screen shot 2014-05-08 at 3 27 12 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/313697/2920421/d098f094-d6e6-11e3-9cf3-4bf90a3cae82.png)

I don't believe this is strictly an issue in underscore-plus.js, but rather something in the Atom core calling underscore-plus is causing the problem.

Edit: Forgot to mention I was using React... disabling React does in fact fix the problem.

data.title: Cursor should jump to end on click below last line
data.body:
When a user clicks below the last line, the cursor should jump to the end of the last line.

Unfortunately clicks aren't visible in this screencast:

![Screencast](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2743004/2920080/8191097c-d6e2-11e3-8231-b98e5a5f26a8.gif)

data.title: Use travis.ci
data.body: :game_die: Very work in progress :game_die:

data.title: Error when I run 'script/build'

Hi, I got some trouble to install Atom on Linux Mint (Petra 64 bits)


I think node-gyp is the problem, but I never used it before.
Here the versions of node, node-gyp and npm

``` sh
simon@simon-Inspiron-3521 ~/atom $ node-gyp -v
v0.10.9
simon@simon-Inspiron-3521 ~/atom $ node -v
v0.10.28
simon@simon-Inspiron-3521 ~/atom $ npm -v
1.4.9
simon@simon-Inspiron-3521 ~/atom $ npm config get python
/usr/bin/pyhon2.7
```

Thanks for reading

data.title: Too long lines are cut off and not fully visible
data.body:
![atomlonglines](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2743004/2919140/0e12c1e8-d6d8-11e3-8d70-d80e5de0a3c7.png)

Same happens if preview isn't there, but it's useful to see if the content is actually there.

data.title: Soft Wrap Is Not Applied To Unsaved Files After Turning It On
data.body:
I just installed the latest version of Atom yesterday, and have been trying it out.  I had an unsaved file open and noticed that soft wrap was not on.  I went into the preferences panel, turned it on, and went back to my open file (not saved yet) and soft wrap still wasn't applied.

Instead, I copied the text, and pasted it into a new unsaved file and soft wrap was working then.  

Maybe this happens for files that are already open too?  Not sure.

data.title: Atom opens Webkit inspector when switching git branches
data.body:
When Atom is open but in the background and I checkout a different git repo and then `git pull origin $whatever`, Atom opens the Webkit Inspector.

Installed yesterday, most recent version, via Homebrew with the language-scala add-on.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1057334/2917639/3e28e052-d6c8-11e3-89d6-4d36b3b28e89.png)

data.title: Atom doesn't quit properly
data.body:
Everytime I quit Atom, either by using the menu item File -> Quit, or using CMD+Q in the keyboard, I get this message:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/464121/2917540/31a22fce-d6c7-11e3-8fd9-e798c2a69576.png)

If I wait, nothing happens. If I click "wait", the program closes immediately.

Doesn't look very good if an Application can't quit properly :baby:

data.title: Status bar keeps showing old highlight mode on change
data.body:
Atom's status bar keeps showing the old highlight mode if it's changed.

![atomstatuspanel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2743004/2916936/9ff73f34-d6c0-11e3-94c7-5312ac25d9af.png)

data.title: Markdown package keybindings should display in the dropdown menu
data.body:
The default keybinding to toggle the Markdown Preview is `Ctrl-Shift-m`.

If you go to the Packages -> Markdown menu, the "Toggle Preview" choice has no listed keybinding.

![screen shot 2014-05-16 at 3 04 09 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14329/3001204/e959ec54-dd2c-11e3-9cc5-d3c02b8181f5.png)

I noticed that other packages have keybindings which display properly (such as Styleguide and Snippets), so I'm not sure why the Markdown Toggle Preview command does not have its keybinding displayed currently.

data.title: How to build and run on Ubuntu Trusty 14.04
data.body:
Not an issue, works for me. But posting here since others stated problems.
I have created a [Dockerfile](https://index.docker.io/u/webwurst/atom-build/) that builds Atom on Ubuntu 14.04.

Hopefully my listed [instruction](https://github.com/webwurst/docker_base_files/blob/master/atom/README.md) are correct, too.

data.title: No graphical interface after compiling on Windows
data.body:
I am not able to open Atom after building atom on my Windows machine. The Atom icon pops up in my taskbar and it is showing me these two windows, which aren't visible without hovering the Atom icon in the taskbar. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7524012/2916180/377025aa-d6b8-11e3-9ad2-5964595b9f7d.png)

data.title: Can't read last line, horizontal scrollbar is blocking it
data.body:
If the horizontal scrollbar is visible the last line is not clearly visible! See screenshot for detail:
![screenshot from 2014-05-08 15 04 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7259755/2915748/a48771cc-d6b1-11e3-805a-d43b1a906a84.png)

Expected behaviour clear visible last line, the scrollbar should be below the the line.

data.title: Remove unused requirements at Atom
data.body: They are required but not used.

data.title: Switch from coffeescript to javascript
data.body: Coffeescript is exactly the same as javascript only with a few hundred new idiosyncracies to learn. It's not worth it, please consider this.

data.title: No next line when hitting return
data.body: Yesterday the editor started to cause me problems when I would hit return for a new line. When I would do so there was no new line and anything I typed would not show up. Do not know if I need to do a reinstall or not. Version 0.94.0 (0.94.0)

data.title: Ubuntu 14.04 js-error in the app
data.body:
I successfully compiled .deb package without any errors. Then I installed it.
The Atom opens but I receive the error at start:

TypeError: Unable to watch path
  at HandleWatcher.start (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:65:29)
  at new HandleWatcher (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:29:12)
  at new PathWatcher (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:119:30)
  at Object.exports.watch (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:178:12)
  at Config.module.exports.Config.observeUserConfig (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/config.js:90:109)
  at Config.module.exports.Config.load (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/config.js:67:19)
  at Atom.module.exports.Atom.startEditorWindow (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/atom.js:342:19)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:14:8)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:20:4)
  at Module._compile (module.js:455:26)
  at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:473:10)
  at Module.load (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:311:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:363:17)
  at require (module.js:379:17)
  at window.onload (file:///usr/share/atom/resources/app/static/index.js:20:5)

What can cause the problem?

data.title: Shift backspace keymap
data.body:
Within windows build shift-backspace currently does nothing. Behaviour
untested in linux (perhaps linux.cson should be modified too?)

data.title: Everything's right but, can't install atom on Ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
It seems like script/build should generate something under /tmp/atom\* but it does not.
Does anyone know where's the catch?

thx

Bost

~/dev/atom$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

~/dev/atom$ uname -i
x86_64

~/dev/atom$ nodejs -v
v0.10.28

~/dev/atom$ npm -v
1.4.9

~/dev/atom$ sudo apt-get install libgnome-keyring-dev
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree  
Reading state information... Done
libgnome-keyring-dev is already the newest version.
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.

~/dev/atom$ sudo npm config set python /usr/bin/python2 -g

~/dev/atom$ script/build # Creates application at /tmp/atom-build/Atom

~/dev/atom$ ls -la /tmp/atom/
ls: cannot access /tmp/atom/: No such file or directory

data.title: Fix windows build instructions
data.body:
There is a mistake in the line,

Add C:\Python27;C:\Program Files\nodejs;C:\Users<user>\github\atom\node_modules\ to your PATH

The node_modules directory does not exist.

data.title: Performance degradation with many multi cursors
data.body:
When I did a lot of multi cursors (more than 5), I noticed a very strong lags. When moving them, Atom Helper using a lot CPU at same time.
OSX Maverick 10.9.0
Atom ver. 0.94.0

data.title: 2MB file size limitaition
data.body: Any ideas how to fix this?

data.title: Feature request: cut the line with ctrl-x
data.body:
Hi,
If no text selected and pressed `^ X` it would be great to cut the whole line. But now it cut only next symbol.

data.title: +FreeBSD, -bullshit
data.body: Signed-off-by: Cthulhux zeug@tuxproject.de

data.title: Make atom build behind firewalls
data.body: This is to get install to work behind firewalls where `git://` is blocked.

data.title: Cursor appears in different location to where text appears
data.body:
Not sure how but there is at least one scenario where the text appears in a different location to where the cursor is:

![screen shot 2014-05-08 at 06 51 54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1575509/2912291/8a55cc90-d675-11e3-83ba-4c605a384bd9.png)
The above has the cursor appearing after the closing bracket of `isset()` but when I press "$" it appears inside the bracket

![screen shot 2014-05-08 at 06 52 02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1575509/2912299/a9652b12-d675-11e3-9478-705e24a49677.png)
Above the the after shot

I've tried reproducing the issue in a smaller set of text but have been unable to, it may require the a few hundred lines before occuring, it was on line 475 that this was happening in a PHP file

data.title: :memo: Some simple documentation fixes
atom.io/faq outdated
data.body:
It runs on Linux and Windows, you just have to build it yourself.

https://atom.io/faq

data.title: in Packages pane, remove the updated packages in 'Available Updates' section
data.body:
In Packages pane, the updated packages in 'Available Updates' section should probably be removed once the update is done, as of 0.94.0 version, here's the following behaviour:
- clicked update icon for package eg. fizzy
- once update is done, the check icon appears on the top right
- then the fizzy package stays in the update section forever or until atom is restarted

Also, the update button should be disabled once the update is in progress or done with the package update.

![screen shot 2014-05-08 at 5 02 59 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/36795/2912092/8a073ce2-d670-11e3-9f9d-d1625c6ada80.png)
